t: John 5
The Healing at Bethesda
After*p these things there was a feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
Now*p there is in Jerusalem by the sheep gate*i a pool, which is called in Hebrew Bethesda, having five porticoes.
In these lay a multitude of those who were sick, blind, lame, and withered, [waiting for the moving of the waters;

for an angel of the Lord went down at certain seasons into the pool and stirred up the water; whoever then first, after the stirring up of the water, stepped in was made well from whatever disease with which he was afflicted.]
A man was there who had been ill for thirty-eight years.
When Jesus saw him lying there,*i and knew that he had already been a long time in*i that*i condition,*i He said to him, “Do*r you*r wish*r to*r get*r well?”*r
The sick man answered Him, “Sir, I have no man to put me into the pool when the water is stirred up, but while I am coming, another steps down before me.”
Jesus said to him, “Get*r up,*r pick*r up*r your*r pallet*r and*r walk.”*r
Immediately the man became well, and picked up his pallet and began*i to walk. Now*bp it was the Sabbath on that day.
So the Jews were saying to the man who was cured, “It is the Sabbath, and it is not permissible for you to carry your pallet.”
But he answered them, “He who made me well was the one who said to me, ‘Pick*r up*r your*r pallet*r and*r walk.’”*r
They asked him, “Who is the man who said to you, ‘Pick*r up*r your*ir pallet*ir and*r walk’?”*r
But the man who was healed did not know who it was, for Jesus had slipped away while there was a crowd in that*i place.
Afterward Jesus found him in the temple and said to him, “Behold,*r you*r have*r become*r well;*r do*r not*r sin*r anymore,*r so*r that*r nothing*r worse*r happens*r to*r you.”*r
The man went away, and told the Jews that it was Jesus who had made him well.
For this reason the Jews were persecuting Jesus, because He was doing these things on the Sabbath.
But He answered them, “My*r Father*r is*r working*r until*r now,*r and*r I*r Myself*r am*r working.”*r
Jesus’ Equality with God
For*p this reason therefore the Jews were seeking all the more to kill Him, because He not only was breaking the Sabbath, but also was calling God His own Father, making Himself equal with God.

Therefore*p Jesus answered and was saying to them, “Truly,*r truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r the*r Son*r can*r do*r nothing*r of*r Himself,*r unless*r it*ir is*ir something*r He*r sees*r the*r Father*r doing;*r for*r whatever*r the*r Father*r does,*r these*r things*r the*r Son*r also*r does*r in*r like*r manner.*r

For*r the*r Father*r loves*r the*r Son,*r and*r shows*r Him*r all*r things*r that*r He*r Himself*r is*r doing;*r and*r the*ir Father*ir will*r show*r Him*r greater*r works*r than*r these,*r so*r that*r you*r will*r marvel.*r
For*r just*r as*r the*r Father*r raises*r the*r dead*r and*r gives*r them*r life,*r even*r so*r the*r Son*r also*r gives*r life*r to*r whom*r He*r wishes.*r
For*r not*r even*r the*r Father*r judges*r anyone,*r but*r He*r has*r given*r all*r judgment*r to*r the*r Son,*r
so*r that*r all*r will*r honor*r the*r Son*r even*r as*r they*r honor*r the*r Father.*r He*r who*r does*r not*r honor*r the*r Son*r does*r not*r honor*r the*r Father*r who*r sent*r Him.*r

“Truly,*rp truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r he*r who*r hears*r My*r word,*r and*r believes*r Him*r who*r sent*r Me,*r has*r eternal*r life,*r and*r does*r not*r come*r into*r judgment,*r but*r has*r passed*r out*r of*r death*r into*r life.*r
Two Resurrections

Truly,*rp truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r an*r hour*r is*r coming*r and*r now*r is,*r when*r the*r dead*r will*r hear*r the*r voice*r of*r the*r Son*r of*r God,*r and*r those*r who*r hear*r will*r live.*r
For*r just*r as*r the*r Father*r has*r life*r in*r Himself,*r even*r so*r He*r gave*r to*r the*r Son*r also*r to*r have*r life*r in*r Himself;*r
and*r He*r gave*r Him*r authority*r to*r execute*r judgment,*r because*r He*r is*r the*ir Son*r of*r Man.*r
Do*r not*r marvel*r at*r this;*r for*r an*r hour*r is*r coming,*r in*r which*r all*r who*r are*r in*r the*r tombs*r will*r hear*r His*r voice,*r
and*r will*r come*r forth;*r those*r who*r did*r the*r good*r deeds*ir to*r a*r resurrection*r of*r life,*r those*r who*r committed*r the*r evil*r deeds*ir to*r a*r resurrection*r of*r judgment.*r

“I*rp can*r do*r nothing*r on*r My*r own*r initiative.*r As*r I*r hear,*r I*r judge;*r and*r My*r judgment*r is*r just,*r because*r I*r do*r not*r seek*r My*r own*r will,*r but*r the*r will*r of*r Him*r who*r sent*r Me.*r
“If*rp I*r alone*ir testify*r about*r Myself,*r My*r testimony*r is*r not*r true.*r
There*r is*r another*r who*r testifies*r of*r Me,*r and*r I*r know*r that*r the*r testimony*r which*r He*r gives*r about*r Me*r is*r true.*r
Witness of John
You*rp have*r sent*r to*r John,*r and*r he*r has*r testified*r to*r the*r truth.*r
But*r the*r testimony*r which*r I*r receive*r is*r not*r from*r man,*r but*r I*r say*r these*r things*r so*r that*r you*r may*r be*r saved.*r
He*r was*r the*r lamp*r that*r was*r burning*r and*r was*r shining*r and*r you*r were*r willing*r to*r rejoice*r for*r a*r while*r in*r his*r light.*r
Witness of Works

But*rp the*r testimony*r which*r I*r have*r is*r greater*r than*r the*ir testimony*ir of*ir John;*r for*r the*r works*r which*r the*r Father*r has*r given*r Me*r to*r accomplish—the*r very*r works*r that*r I*r do—testify*r about*r Me,*r that*r the*r Father*r has*r sent*r Me.*r
Witness of the Father
And*rp the*r Father*r who*r sent*r Me,*r He*r has*r testified*r of*r Me.*r You*r have*r neither*r heard*r His*r voice*r at*r any*r time*r nor*r seen*r His*r form.*r
You*r do*r not*r have*r His*r word*r abiding*r in*r you,*r for*r you*r do*r not*r believe*r Him*r whom*r He*r sent.*r
Witness of the Scripture
You*rp search*r the*r Scriptures*r because*r you*r think*r that*r in*r them*r you*r have*r eternal*r life;*r it*r is*r these*r that*r testify*r about*r Me;*r
and*r you*r are*r unwilling*r to*r come*r to*r Me*r so*r that*r you*r may*r have*r life.*r
I*r do*r not*r receive*r glory*r from*r men;*r
but*r I*r know*r you,*r that*r you*r do*r not*r have*r the*r love*r of*r God*r in*r yourselves.*r
I*r have*r come*r in*r My*r Father’s*r name,*r and*r you*r do*r not*r receive*r Me;*r if*r another*r comes*r in*r his*r own*r name,*r you*r will*r receive*r him.*r
How*r can*r you*r believe,*r when*r you*r receive*r glory*r from*r one*r another*r and*r you*r do*r not*r seek*r the*r glory*r that*r is*r from*r the*r one*ir and*ir only*r God?*r
Do*r not*r think*r that*r I*r will*r accuse*r you*r before*r the*r Father;*r the*r one*r who*r accuses*r you*r is*r Moses,*r in*r whom*r you*r have*r set*r your*r hope.*r
For*r if*r you*r believed*r Moses,*r you*r would*r believe*r Me,*r for*r he*r wrote*r about*r Me.*r
But*r if*r you*r do*r not*r believe*r his*r writings,*r how*r will*r you*r believe*r My*r words?”*r
